newsitem.title: UK: BA, Rivaud bid 780 mln francs for Liberte.
newsitem.headline: BA, Rivaud bid 780 mln francs for Liberte.

text.p: British Airways and French bank Groupe Rivaud's new joint bid for Air Liberte is offering 780 million francs for the insolvent French regional carrier, industry sources said on Wednesday.
In addition Rivaud as Air Liberte's biggest existing shareholder is to write off existing convertible debts of just over 500 million francs, they said.

The offer is 630 million francs for the share capital plus an additional 150 million francs to cover costs incurred by Air Liberte's administrator. BA is to pay 440 million francs for a 70 percent stake plus 100 million of the administration costs.

BA launched its own bid for Air Liberte earlier this month. It originally offered 25 million francs but industry sources said that that offer to the administrator had already been raised to 100 million francs.
BA revealed last week it had also already offered to invest a further 440 million francs in turning Liberte back into profit within three years.
Air Liberte's administrator announced earlier that BA and Rivaud had submitted their new joint bid.
